children.text: During the pandemic, many people thought of starting a side business, so I decided to see if my candle-making hobby could be profitable!
It looks like I could make a profit
and some side income based on my assumptions below. Feedback welcome!
How many candles can I make per year and where would I price them?
💰 How much would I make before expenses?
🕑 What is the cost of making a candle?
What is the average cost per candle, including the development costs, lost candles, and freebies?
Looking only at the direct costs involved in the production, how much will I make throughout the years?
💸 How much will I pay for the act of candle-making and inflation?
What percentage of my net revenue
would I allocate to marketing initiatives?
💰 After deducting my operating costs from above, how much am I making pre-tax?
🤔 So, what's the verdict? Should I start?
in profits in my first year
to reinvest into more candle-making, and could make as much as
as side income (as defined in the labor cost above).

in a year! 

Maybe not such a bad idea after all …
